marker.name: American Buyers Guild
marker.desc: A mattress business which was once housed in the building that now holds the Exterminator indoor roller-coaster.

marker.name: Babyland
marker.desc: A children's furnishing store, the building's soft blue pallet & toy block signage were a mainstay of the area until it closed in 2012.

marker.name: Bassenheim
marker.desc: The first building in Zelienople, a three story wooden castle which stood for the first 40 years of the town's history, before being destroyed by fire in 1842.

marker.name: Bruster's Ice Cream
marker.desc: Well-known ice cream shop, highly visible because of its location & street-level walk-up window.

marker.name: Chiodo's Tavern
marker.address: 133 W 8th Ave Homestead, PA 15120 United States

marker.name: CyberConXion
marker.desc: A 3700 square foot gaming center in Squirrel Hill started by Leon Edelsack and Larry Hochendoner that offered PC and console gaming, served as a social space, and hosted birthday parties.

marker.name: Green Gables Restaurant
marker.address: Hoffman Blvd at Kennywood Blvd, Duquesne PA, 15110

marker.name: Mayview State Hospital
marker.desc: Originally a house for the poor, orphans and the mentally ill, Mayview State Hospital grew in size through the middle of the century until it's decline in the 1990s and eventually closure in 2008.

marker.name: Red Bull Inn
marker.desc: Historic chain of restaurants in the Pittsburgh region

marker.name: Red Bull Inn Steakhouse
marker.desc: Steakhouse in Robinson opened by the family of the former owners of the Red Bull Inn

marker.name: St. Leo Church
marker.desc: St. Leo Church was erected as the home of a German Catholic parish in Pittsburgh's North Side in the late 1880's.

marker.name: Stanley Theatre
marker.desc: This former movie theater and concert hal was known as a famous rock music venue. It was refurbished, and reopened as the Benedum Center for the Performing Arts in 1987.

marker.name: Syria Mosque
marker.desc: Concert hall in Oakland that hosted musical performances and political speeches from 1916-1991

marker.name: The Ankara Nightclub
marker.desc: Night Club & Supper Club on Route 51 in Pleasant Hills.
marker.address: PA Route 51 and Lewis Run Road, Pleasant Hills, PA 15236

marker.name: The King's Court Theater
marker.desc: Popular theatre for students, especially in the '60s and '70s

marker.name: The Log Jammer
marker.desc: This log-flume ride was a beloved feature of Kennywood Amusement Park from its opening in 1975, to its last season in 2017.
